newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Philips, Jordan in toothbrush tie-up.
newsitem.headline: Philips, Jordan in toothbrush tie-up.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV and oral hygiene company Jordan said on Tuesday they had concluded an alliance aimed at establishing a dominant position in the mechanical oral care market.

The first fruit of the alliance will be a new electric toothbrush, the Philips/Jordan 2-action plaque remover, currently in clinical trials and due to be launched later this year, Philips said in a statement.
"Philips/Jordan expects to become a dominant player in dental care by the year 2000," it said.
No financial details of the alliance were given.
The world oral care market has an estimated retail value of over eight billion dollars, with electric toothbrushes representing five to 10 percent of that market, Philips said.
Around 4.2 million electric dental care appliances were expected to be sold this year in the U.S. and 3.7 million in Europe, it added.
"... we expect to achieve a major market share," said Wil van den Berg, managing director of Philips domestic appliances.
Jordan is one of the leading global players in mechanical oral care, ranked fourth in the world, Philips said.
